When I graph fitness versus generations, I see large areas where the 
syste=
m is making very little progress. While there can be some small 
changes in=
 the fitness (essentially noise). The average slope over the 
last N genera=
tions will be very flat. I am trying to identify these 
fitness plateaus.

=
I am using an exponential moving average of the first differences of 
the f=
itness to quantify whether or not I am in a fitness plateau. In 
other word=
s each generation I am calculating the difference in fitness 
from the last=
 generation. Then I am calculating a moving average of the 
last N generati=
ons; but giving more weight to the most recent values.

Has anyone else wor=
ked on a similar problem? How did they approach it?

Regards,

Shane
